Package main.java.neat.config

Class NEATConfigBuilder

java.lang.Object
main.java.neat.config.NEATConfigBuilder
public class NEATConfigBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
Builder class for creating and configuring NEAT algorithm parameters. This class implements the Builder pattern to provide a fluent, chainable API for constructing NEATConfig objects. It allows for clean, readable configuration of all NEAT algorithm parameters without requiring complex constructors or extensive parameter lists. All builder methods follow the convention of setting a parameter and returning the builder instance for method chaining. Many methods also include validation to ensure parameters are within valid ranges. Example usage: 
 NEATConfig config = new NEATConfigBuilder(150, 4, 2)  // Population size, inputs, outputs
     .setFeedForward(true)                          // Feed-forward only networks
     .setProbAddNode(0.03)                          // Probability of adding nodes
     .setProbAddConnection(0.05)                    // Probability of adding connections
     .setInitConnectivity(CONNECTIVITY.FULL_DIRECT)  // Initial connection pattern
     .build();                                      // Create the configuration
Author:
Taher Joudeh

    Creates a new NEATConfigBuilder with the specified core parameters and custom activation and aggregation configurations.

  • Constructor Details

    • NEATConfigBuilder

      public NEATConfigBuilder​(int populationSize, int numberOfInputs, int numberOfOutputs)
      Creates a new NEATConfigBuilder with the specified core parameters. This constructor initializes a NEATConfig with required parameters and default configurations for activation and aggregation functions.
      Parameters:
      populationSize - The size of the population (number of genomes), if less than 1, then keep it to the default value (1).
      numberOfInputs - The number of input nodes in each network.
      numberOfOutputs - The number of output nodes in each network.

    • NEATConfigBuilder

      public NEATConfigBuilder​(int populationSize, int numberOfInputs, int numberOfOutputs, AggregationConfig aggregationConfig, ActivationConfig activationConfig)
      Creates a new NEATConfigBuilder with the specified core parameters and custom activation and aggregation configurations. The value of populationSize is clamped to be at least one. This constructor allows full customization of all initial configurations.
      Parameters:
      populationSize - The size of the population (number of genomes). If less than 1, then keep it to the default value (1).
      numberOfInputs - The number of input nodes in each network.
      numberOfOutputs - The number of output nodes in each network.
      aggregationConfig - The custom aggregation function configuration.
      activationConfig - The custom activation function configuration.

  • Method Details

    • setFitnessCriterion

      public NEATConfigBuilder setFitnessCriterion​(NEATConfig.FITNESS_CRITERION fitnessCriterion)
      Sets the fitness criterion for the NEAT algorithm. This determines whether the algorithm aims to maximize or minimize fitness values. Default value is MAX.
      Parameters:
      fitnessCriterion - The fitness criterion (MIN or MAX). If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setFitnessTermination

      public NEATConfigBuilder setFitnessTermination​(boolean fitnessTermination)
      Sets whether the evolution should terminate upon reaching a fitness threshold. When enabled, evolution will stop when the best genome's fitness reaches the threshold defined by setFitnessTerminationThreshold(). Default value is false.
      Parameters:
      fitnessTermination - true to enable fitness-based termination.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setFitnessTerminationThreshold

      public NEATConfigBuilder setFitnessTerminationThreshold​(double fitnessThreshold)
      Sets the fitness threshold for termination. Evolution stops when the best genome's fitness reaches this value (if fitness termination is enabled). Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      fitnessThreshold - The fitness threshold value. If less than zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setGenerationTermination

      public NEATConfigBuilder setGenerationTermination​(boolean generationTermination)
      Sets whether the evolution should terminate after a specific number of generations. When enabled, evolution will stop after the number of generations defined by setGenerationTerminationThreshold(). Default value is false.
      Parameters:
      generationTermination - true to enable generation-based termination.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setGenerationTerminationThreshold

      public NEATConfigBuilder setGenerationTerminationThreshold​(int generationThreshold)
      Sets the generation threshold for termination. Evolution stops after this many generations (if generation termination is enabled). Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      generationThreshold - The maximum number of generations to run. If less than 1, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setSpeciesFitnessFunction

      public NEATConfigBuilder setSpeciesFitnessFunction​(NEATConfig.SPECIES_FITNESS_FUNCTION speciesFitnessFunction)
      Sets the method used to calculate species fitness from member genome fitnesses. This affects which species are considered fit for reproduction and survival. Default value is MEAN.
      Parameters:
      speciesFitnessFunction - The species fitness function (MIN, MAX, MEAN, or MEDIAN). If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setStagnation

      public NEATConfigBuilder setStagnation​(int stagnation)
      Sets the number of generations with no improvement before a species is considered stagnant. Stagnant species may be eliminated to make room for innovation. Default value is 15.
      Parameters:
      stagnation - The stagnation threshold in generations. If less than 1, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setSpeciesElitism

      public NEATConfigBuilder setSpeciesElitism​(int speciesElitism)
      Sets the number of species to preserve even if they stagnate. This ensures diversity by maintaining some historical lineages. Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      speciesElitism - The number of species protected from stagnation-based elimination. If less than zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setElitism

      public NEATConfigBuilder setElitism​(int elitism)
      Sets the number of top performing genomes within each species to preserve unchanged in each generation. These elite genomes pass to the next generation without mutation. Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      elitism - The number of elite genomes preserved in each generation. If less than zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setSurvivalThreshold

      public NEATConfigBuilder setSurvivalThreshold​(double survivalThreshold)
      Sets the fraction of genomes in each species that are selected for reproduction. Only the top-performing genomes within this threshold reproduce. Default value is 0.5.
      Parameters:
      survivalThreshold - The survival threshold as a fraction between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setSelectionType

      public NEATConfigBuilder setSelectionType​(NEATConfig.SELECTION_TYPE selectionType)
      Sets the method used for selecting parent genomes during reproduction. Influences which genomes get to reproduce and how selection pressure is applied. Default value is ROULETTE_WHEEL.
      Parameters:
      selectionType - The selection type (ROULETTE_WHEEL or TOURNAMENT). If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setTournamentSize

      public NEATConfigBuilder setTournamentSize​(int tournamentSize)
      Sets the number of genomes to consider in tournament selection. Higher values increase selection pressure toward fitter genomes. Only used when selectionType is TOURNAMENT. Default value is 1.
      Parameters:
      tournamentSize - The tournament size. If less than 1, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setCompatibilityThreshold

      public NEATConfigBuilder setCompatibilityThreshold​(double compatibilityThreshold)
      Sets the threshold for genome compatibility determining species membership. Genomes with compatibility distance below this threshold are considered the same species. Higher values result in fewer species as more genomes will be grouped together. Lower values create more species with fewer members in each. Default value is 3.
      Parameters:
      compatibilityThreshold - The compatibility threshold value. If less than zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setCompatibilityExcessCoefficient

      public NEATConfigBuilder setCompatibilityExcessCoefficient​(double compatibilityExcessCoefficient)
      Sets the coefficient for excess genes in compatibility distance calculation. Higher values give more weight to excess genes when determining species membership. Excess genes are those that exist beyond the highest innovation number in the other genome being compared. Default value is 1.
      Parameters:
      compatibilityExcessCoefficient - The excess genes coefficient. If less than zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setCompatibilityDisjointCoefficient

      public NEATConfigBuilder setCompatibilityDisjointCoefficient​(double compatibilityDisjointCoefficient)
      Sets the coefficient for disjoint genes in compatibility distance calculation. Higher values give more weight to disjoint genes when determining species membership. Disjoint genes are those that exist in one genome but not the other, excluding excess genes. Default value is 1.
      Parameters:
      compatibilityDisjointCoefficient - The disjoint genes coefficient. If less than zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setCompatibilityWeightCoefficient

      public NEATConfigBuilder setCompatibilityWeightCoefficient​(double compatibilityWeightCoefficient)
      Sets the coefficient for weight differences in compatibility distance calculation. Higher values give more weight to connection weight differences when determining species membership. This factor accounts for how differently weighted the matching connections are between genomes. Default value is 0.5.
      Parameters:
      compatibilityWeightCoefficient - The weight difference coefficient. If less than zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setDynamicCompatabilityThreshold

      public NEATConfigBuilder setDynamicCompatabilityThreshold​(boolean dynamicCompatabilityThreshold)
      Sets whether the compatibility threshold should be adjusted dynamically. When true, the threshold is adjusted to maintain the target number of species. This can help maintain an appropriate level of diversity in the population. Default value is false.
      Parameters:
      dynamicCompatabilityThreshold - true to enable dynamic adjustment.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setTargetNumberOfSpecies

      public NEATConfigBuilder setTargetNumberOfSpecies​(int targetNumberOfSpecies)
      Sets the target number of species when using dynamic compatibility threshold. The compatibility threshold is adjusted to try to maintain this many species. Only relevant when dynamic compatibility threshold is enabled. Default value is 1.
      Parameters:
      targetNumberOfSpecies - The target number of species. If less than 1, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setCompatabilityThresholdAdjustingFactor

      public NEATConfigBuilder setCompatabilityThresholdAdjustingFactor​(double compatabilityThresholdAdjustingFactor)
      Sets the factor by which to adjust compatibility threshold when using dynamic adjustment. Controls how quickly the threshold is adjusted to reach the target number of species. Higher values cause faster adjustment but may lead to oscillation. Default value is 0.1.
      Parameters:
      compatabilityThresholdAdjustingFactor - The threshold adjustment factor. If less than or equal to zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setStartingHiddenNodes

      public NEATConfigBuilder setStartingHiddenNodes​(int... hiddenNodes)
      Sets the array specifying the number of hidden nodes in each hidden layer at initialization. For example, passing (5, 3) would create two hidden layers with 5 and 3 nodes respectively. An empty array creates networks with no initial hidden nodes. Default value is an empty array.
      Parameters:
      hiddenNodes - Variable number of integers defining nodes per hidden layer. If there's a value which is less than zero, that value will not be taken.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setMaxNumberOfHiddenNodes

      public NEATConfigBuilder setMaxNumberOfHiddenNodes​(int maxNumberOfHiddenNodes)
      Sets the maximum number of hidden nodes allowed in the network (mutation exclusive). Prevents networks from growing too large during evolution. Default value Integer.MAX_VALUE (uncapped).
      Parameters:
      maxNumberOfHiddenNodes - The maximum number of hidden nodes allowed. If less than zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setStartingAggregationFunction

      public NEATConfigBuilder setStartingAggregationFunction​(AggregationFunction.AGGREGATION_FUNCTION startingAggregationFunction)
      Sets the default aggregation function for new nodes. This function determines how a node combines its inputs. Default value is SUM.
      Parameters:
      startingAggregationFunction - The default aggregation function. If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setStartingActivationFunctionForHiddenNodes

      public NEATConfigBuilder setStartingActivationFunctionForHiddenNodes​(ActivationFunction.ACTIVATION_FUNCTION startingActivationFunctionForHiddenNodes)
      Sets the default activation function for new hidden nodes. This function determines how a hidden node transforms its aggregated input to output. Default value is SIGMOID.
      Parameters:
      startingActivationFunctionForHiddenNodes - The default activation function for hidden nodes. If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setStartingActivationFunctionForOutputNodes

      Sets the default activation function for new output nodes. This function determines how an output node transforms its aggregated input to output. Default value is SIGMOID.
      Parameters:
      startingActivationFunctionForOutputNodes - The default activation function for output nodes. If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setInitConnectivity

      public NEATConfigBuilder setInitConnectivity​(NEATConfig.CONNECTIVITY initConnectivity)
      Sets the initial connectivity pattern for new genomes. Determines how nodes are connected when a network is first created. Different patterns provide different starting points for evolution. Default value is UNCONNECTED (no connections).
      Parameters:
      initConnectivity - The initial connectivity pattern. If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setActivationDefault

      public NEATConfigBuilder setActivationDefault​(ActivationFunction.ACTIVATION_FUNCTION activationDefault)
      Sets the default activation function for nodes created during evolution. This defines which activation function is used when new nodes are created through mutation and no specific function is assigned. This is separate from the starting activation functions for initial network configuration. Common choices: - SIGMOID (default) - RELU - TANH - LINEAR - STEP
      Parameters:
      activationDefault - Default activation function for new nodes. If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance.

    • setActivationMutationRate

      public NEATConfigBuilder setActivationMutationRate​(double activationMutationRate)
      Sets the probability of mutating a node's activation function. Higher values make activation function mutations more frequent. Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      activationMutationRate - The activation function mutation rate between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setAggregationDefault

      public NEATConfigBuilder setAggregationDefault​(AggregationFunction.AGGREGATION_FUNCTION aggregationDefault)
      Sets the default aggregation function for nodes created during evolution. Determines how new nodes will combine their input signals when created through mutation. This is separate from the starting aggregation function used during initial network creation. Common choices: - SUM (default) - PRODUCT - MIN - MAX - MEAN - MAXABS
      Parameters:
      aggregationDefault - Default aggregation function for new nodes. If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance.

    • setAggregationMutationRate

      public NEATConfigBuilder setAggregationMutationRate​(double aggregationMutationRate)
      Sets the probability of mutating a node's aggregation function. Higher values make aggregation function mutations more frequent. Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      aggregationMutationRate - The aggregation function mutation rate between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setBiasInitMean

      public NEATConfigBuilder setBiasInitMean​(double biasInitMean)
      Sets the mean for initializing node bias values. Used with the bias initialization distribution. Default value is 0.
      Parameters:
      biasInitMean - The bias initialization mean
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining

    • setBiasInitStdev

      public NEATConfigBuilder setBiasInitStdev​(double biasInitStdev)
      Sets the standard deviation for initializing node bias values. Default value is 1.
      Parameters:
      biasInitStdev - The bias initialization standard deviation. If less than zero, the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setBiasInitDistributionType

      public NEATConfigBuilder setBiasInitDistributionType​(NEATConfig.DISTRIBUTION biasInitDistributionType)
      Sets the distribution type for initializing node bias values. Determines whether biases are initialized with uniform or normal distribution. Default value is NORMAL.
      Parameters:
      biasInitDistributionType - The bias initialization distribution type. If null, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setBiasMaxValue

      public NEATConfigBuilder setBiasMaxValue​(double biasMaxValue)
      Sets the maximum allowed value for node biases. Biases are clamped to this value during initialization and mutation. Default value is 50.
      Parameters:
      biasMaxValue - The maximum bias value.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setBiasMinValue

      public NEATConfigBuilder setBiasMinValue​(double biasMinValue)
      Sets the minimum allowed value for node biases. Biases are clamped to this value during initialization and mutation. Default value is -50.
      Parameters:
      biasMinValue - The minimum bias value.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setBiasMutationPower

      public NEATConfigBuilder setBiasMutationPower​(double biasMutationPower)
      Sets the power (magnitude) of bias mutations. Controls how much a bias can change in a single mutation. Larger values allow for bigger jumps in bias values. Default value is 0.1 (10%).
      Parameters:
      biasMutationPower - The bias mutation power. If less than or equal to zero, then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setBiasAdjustingRate

      public NEATConfigBuilder setBiasAdjustingRate​(double biasAdjustingRate)
      Sets the probability of adjusting a node's bias during mutation. Higher values make small bias adjustments more frequent. Default value is 0.8 (80%).
      Parameters:
      biasAdjustingRate - The bias adjustment rate between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setBiasRandomizingRate

      public NEATConfigBuilder setBiasRandomizingRate​(double biasRandomizingRate)
      Sets the probability of completely randomizing a node's bias during mutation. Higher values make complete bias replacements more frequent. Default value is 0.1 (10%).
      Parameters:
      biasRandomizingRate - The bias randomization rate between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setProbAddConnection

      public NEATConfigBuilder setProbAddConnection​(double probAddConnection)
      Sets the probability of adding a new connection during mutation. Controls how frequently new connections are added to the network. Higher values lead to more complex networks more quickly. Default value is 0.03 (3%).
      Parameters:
      probAddConnection - The add connection probability between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setProbRecurrentConnection

      public NEATConfigBuilder setProbRecurrentConnection​(double probRecurrentConnection)
      Sets the probability that a new connection will be recurrent. Only relevant when feedForward is false. Higher values increase the likelihood of creating recurrent (looping) connections. Default value is 0.1 (10% Knowing the probability for adding a connection has succeeded).
      Parameters:
      probRecurrentConnection - The recurrent connection probability between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setProbDeleteConnection

      public NEATConfigBuilder setProbDeleteConnection​(double probDeleteConnection)
      Sets the probability of deleting a connection during mutation. Controls how frequently connections are removed from the network. Higher values can lead to simpler networks. Default value is 0 (0%).
      Parameters:
      probDeleteConnection - The delete connection probability between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setEnabledDefault

      public NEATConfigBuilder setEnabledDefault​(boolean enabledDefault)
      Sets whether new connections are enabled by default. When false, new connections are created in a disabled state and must be activated through mutation. Default value is true.
      Parameters:
      enabledDefault - true if new connections are enabled by default, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setEnabledMutationRate

      public NEATConfigBuilder setEnabledMutationRate​(double enabledMutationRate)
      Sets the probability of toggling a connection's enabled status during mutation. Controls how frequently connections are enabled or disabled. Default value is 0 (0%).
      Parameters:
      enabledMutationRate - The connection enabled status mutation rate between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setEnabledRateForEnabled

      public NEATConfigBuilder setEnabledRateForEnabled​(double enabledRateForEnabled)
      Sets the additional probability specifically for toggling enabled connections. This parameter adds to the base enabledMutationRate when considering whether to toggle an enabled connection. It allows for asymmetric mutation rates between enabled and disabled connections. Default value is 0 (0%). The total probability for toggling an enabled connection becomes: (enabledMutationRate + enabledRateForEnabled) This parameter lets you fine-tune how frequently enabled connections get disabled during mutation, independent of how frequently disabled connections get enabled. A higher value increases the chance of toggling (disabling) connections that are currently enabled.
      Parameters:
      enabledRateForEnabled - Additional mutation rate specifically for enabled connections.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setEnabledRateForDisabled

      public NEATConfigBuilder setEnabledRateForDisabled​(double enabledRateForDisabled)
      Sets the additional probability specifically for toggling disabled connections. This parameter adds to the base enabledMutationRate when considering whether to toggle a disabled connection. It allows for asymmetric mutation rates between enabled and disabled connections. The total probability for toggling a disabled connection becomes: (enabledMutationRate + enabledRateForDisabled) This parameter lets you fine-tune how frequently disabled connections get enabled during mutation, independent of how frequently enabled connections get disabled. A higher value increases the chance of toggling (enabling) connections that are currently disabled. Default value is 0 (0%).
      Parameters:
      enabledRateForDisabled - Additional mutation rate specifically for disabled connections.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining

    • setFeedForward

      public NEATConfigBuilder setFeedForward​(boolean feedForward)
      Sets whether the network must be strictly feed-forward (no recurrent connections). When true, connections from later nodes to earlier nodes are not allowed. This is typically used for problems that don't have a temporal component. Default value is true.
      Parameters:
      feedForward - true if the network must be feed-forward, false if recurrent connections are allowed.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setProbAddNode

      public NEATConfigBuilder setProbAddNode​(double probAddNode)
      Sets the probability of adding a new node during mutation. Controls how frequently the network topology grows with new neurons. Higher values lead to more complex networks more quickly. Default value is 0.01 (1%).
      Parameters:
      probAddNode - The add node probability between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setProbDeleteNode

      public NEATConfigBuilder setProbDeleteNode​(double probDeleteNode)
      Sets the probability of deleting a node during mutation. Controls how frequently nodes are removed from the network. Higher values can lead to simpler networks. Default value is 0 (0%).
      Parameters:
      probDeleteNode - The delete node probability between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

      responseInitMean - The response initialization mean.

      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setResponseMutationPower

      responseMutationPower - The response mutation power.

      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setResponseAdjustingRate

      public NEATConfigBuilder setResponseAdjustingRate​(double responseAdjustingRate)
      Sets the probability of adjusting a node's response during mutation. Higher values make small response adjustments more frequent. Default value is 0.7 (70%).
      Parameters:
      responseAdjustingRate - The response adjustment rate between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setResponseRandomizingRate

      public NEATConfigBuilder setResponseRandomizingRate​(double responseRandomizingRate)
      Sets the probability of completely randomizing a node's response during mutation. Higher values make complete response replacements more frequent. Default value is 0.1 (10%).
      Parameters:
      responseRandomizingRate - The response randomization rate between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setSingleStructuralMutation

      public NEATConfigBuilder setSingleStructuralMutation​(boolean singleStructuralMutation)
      Sets whether to allow only one structural mutation per genome per generation. When true, only one structural change (add/delete node/connection) can occur per genome. This can help prevent too rapid topology changes. Default value is false.
      Parameters:
      singleStructuralMutation - true if only one structural mutation is allowed, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setStructuralMutationAdvisor

      public NEATConfigBuilder setStructuralMutationAdvisor​(boolean structuralMutationAdvisor)
      Sets whether to use a structural mutation advisor to guide mutation decisions. When enabled, the structural mutation advisor implements the following behaviors: 1. If a "add node" mutation is attempted on a genome with no connections, it automatically redirects to attempting an "add connection" mutation instead, since nodes cannot be added without existing connections to split. 2. If an "add connection" mutation attempts to create a connection that already exists, it automatically toggles that connection's enabled status instead of failing, allowing the mutation to have a meaningful effect. These intelligent redirects help avoid wasted mutation attempts and increase the efficiency of the evolutionary process by ensuring mutations have meaningful effects even in edge cases. Default value is false.
      Parameters:
      structuralMutationAdvisor - true to enable the structural mutation advisor, false to disable it.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setWeightInitMean

      public NEATConfigBuilder setWeightInitMean​(double weightInitMean)

      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • setProbConnectInit

      public NEATConfigBuilder setProbConnectInit​(double probConnectInit)
      Sets the probability of creating each connection when using PARTIAL_* connectivity types. For partial connectivity patterns, each potential connection is created with this probability. A value of 1.0 would create all possible connections, effectively making it equivalent to a FULL_* connectivity type. Default value is 0.5 (50%).
      Parameters:
      probConnectInit - The connection creation probability between 0 and 1. If not [0~1], then the new value will not be set.
      Returns:
      This builder instance for method chaining.

    • build

      public NEATConfig build()
      Builds and returns the configured NEATConfig . This method finalizes the building process and returns the completely configured NEATConfig object. After calling this method, this builder instance should no longer be used.
      Returns:
      The fully configured NEATConfig instance.
